title: Value tracking through ObjectExpression nodes doesn't handle __proto__ properly
body:
- Rollup Version: current master
- Operating System (or Browser): Linux
- Node Version (if applicable): 15.5
- Link to reproduction (IMPORTANT, read below): https://605c3fa99677b800085f7f45--rollup.netlify.app/repl/?version=2.42.4&

```
let y = {foo: true}
let x = {__proto__: y}
if (x.foo) console.log("!")
```

Rollup reduces that to an empty chunk, assuming that since `x` doesn't have a `foo` property, `x.foo` must produce undefined (second return from `ObjectExpression.getLiteralValueAtPath`).

### Expected Behavior

That code will log `"!"` when ran normally, so I'd expect Rollup to preserve the `console.log` call.

### Actual Behavior

The call is optimized out.

Noticed this when reading the code in ObjectExpression.ts for #3989. I suspect the easiest solution would be to just deoptimize if there's a `__proto__` property.
